title: Retail EU Market Entry Strategy Decision
context: Strategic evaluation of entering European retail market through acquisition or greenfield expansion

options.title: Strategic Acquisition of European Retail Chain
options.description: Acquire established European retailer with 50+ stores across 5 countries
options.benefits: Immediate market presence, existing customer base, local expertise
options.risks: Cultural integration challenges, regulatory hurdles, premium valuation

options.title: Greenfield Expansion in Key European Markets
options.description: Open 20 new stores in Germany, France, Netherlands over 3 years
options.benefits: Full control of brand experience, scalable model, lower upfront cost
options.risks: Longer time to market, local competition, regulatory learning curve

options.title: Strategic Partnership with European Retailer
options.description: Form joint venture with local retailer for co-branded stores and shared operations
options.benefits: Shared risk, local market knowledge, faster entry
options.risks: Shared control, potential conflicts, brand dilution

recommendation.rationale: Balances speed of entry with manageable risk and cost, while leveraging local expertise
implementation_plan: Q1 2026: Finalize partnership agreement with European retailer
Q2 2026: Launch pilot co-branded stores in 2 markets
Q3 2026: Expand to 10 locations across 3 countries
Q4 2026: Evaluate performance and plan full rollout
success_metrics: Market share: 5% in target countries within 3 years

risks_and_mitigations.mitigation: Diversify across multiple EU countries, maintain flexible supply chain
Hire local leadership, implement cultural training programs
Hedging strategies, local currency operations where possible
